intro: Linanthus orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Linanthus orcuttii is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
